creator: jenfoxbot
title: (Easy) Light-Up Flower Pin
description: This project guides you through creating a light-up flower pin, a wearable accessory that combines electronics and art. It involves connecting an LED to a coin cell battery and attaching it to a flower, which can then be pinned to clothing using a magnet.
steps: Gather the necessary materials: LED, coin cell battery, coin cell battery case, magnet, flower (real, fake, fabric, or paper), and optional soldering iron/slide switch.

Connect the LED to the battery case: Identify the longer (positive) and shorter (negative) legs of the LED. Place the coin cell in the case with the positive side up. Connect the LED legs to the battery case leads, ensuring the LED lights up. Wrap or solder the connections, and secure with hot glue. If adding a slide switch, connect the middle leg to one of the battery case leads and the outside leg to the appropriate LED leg.
Create or find a flower: You can use various materials to create a flower, such as fabric, paper, or even a real flower. Ensure the material allows light to pass through.
Attach the LED and battery to the flower: Use hot glue to attach the coin cell and LED assembly to the flower. Ensure the battery can still be removed for replacement.
Attach the magnet: Hot glue the magnet to the back of the flower, aligning it so it's attracted to the battery case. This allows the flower to be pinned to clothing.
Use and enjoy: Attach the flower pin to clothing using the magnet. Make sure to keep fabric between the magnet and the battery when not in use.
